intro: Barleria durairajii, commonly known as the Durairajii false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Barleria durairajii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
